name: Edwin K Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Marv and Laurie keep a beautiful B&B, and the five-course breakfasts are a special treat. They go out of their way to recommend interesting places to visit and other B&B's to stay at. The house itself is a beautiful Craft-style building with an interesting history, a pleasant little garden in the back and a front porch perfect for people-watching. We were a bit taken aback by the placement of religious literature and symbols in our bedroom, and presumably the others, which for members of another faith may feel uncomfortable. The Edwin K. is nicely situated for a stroll through Florence's charming Old Town with its galleries and bookstores.
reviews.title: Gracious Hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Edwin K was a delightful surprise. The room, Marv and Laurie, the amazing breakfast, plus treats at all times of the day, made this a stop not to be missed. Our only regret of our 15 day vacation was not staying here more than one night. The whole experience was a joy, and there is so much to do in and around Florence. We could not have been made more welcome. This stop is a must on a trip up the Oregon Coast.
reviews.title: Delightful B and B

likes.liked: — The hosts went out of their way for all the guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2002, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at this B&B has yet to be matched. The wonderful gourmet breakfast and the nightly sherry and the warm wonderful hosts make this B&B feel like home. This B&B holds terrific memories.
reviews.title: Best B&B on the Oregon Coast
Fantastic!
reviews.text: This was absolutely impressive! Recommended to all who stay in Florence! Marv and Laurie were absoulute dolls, and Florence is a lovely little town too. The only 'issue' I can see is that the bathrooms are out in the open - so if you are uncomfortable with a simple sliding door covering the toilet, this mayy not be the place for you! But the jacuzzi was excellent, the double shower was excellent, the room was superb (the 'Spring room' has a great view), the location is great, and the breakfast is phenomenal!!!!! Most gourmet breakfast I have ever had! Recommended to all!

My husaband, 4 month old son and our parents stayed in the lovely little cottage for one night during our drive along the Oregon coast. The owners were delightful and very accommodating as we arrived well before normal check-in time and they rushed to get the place clean so we could put our car full of suit cases in as we had an appoinment to go dune bugging (which i highly reccommend). With a full kitchen, 2 bedrooms, a lounge room and bathroom it was the perfect place for us all to stay, expecially with a baby. My only regret is that we had to leave at 6am the next morning to drive to San Francisco. The location is a 5 min walk to Old Town where we had one of the bext home made pizza's I've ever had (see picture)
reviews.title: Gorgeous little B&B
Top Notch
reviews.text: My wife and I spent the most romantic Vanintines Day at the Edwin K.Our room was absoutly beautiful,overlooking a garden and we were listening to water trickling in the fountin while sitting on our terrace.Breakfast was a memorable experence.We especially enjoyed strolling down Bay street. We love Florence. THANKS A BUNCH L&M

reviews.title: Very beautiful home - everything is first class
reviews.text: My wife and I had a great time at the Edwin K. We fell in love with the house and the way it has been restored. Very elegant throughout. Great full breakfast served. The staff did a excellent job. We will return as soon as possible.

reviews.title: A charming inn
reviews.text: The Edwin K is a pleasant spot to relax and enjoy a visit to the pretty little town of Florence. The house itself is lovely, especially the first floor with the many "Craftsman-style" touches of woodwork and glass built-ins. The rooms are large with several nice touches like small refrigerators and bath accessories. In our room the bath was actually part of the room, which was a bit odd but it worked out. But be advised -- this is not the place to share a room with a friend unless you are VERY good friends! The all but open bathroom area made for a certain intimacy that was fine for me and my spouse but might be difficult otherwise.

The decor is fine if a bit cute for our taste, and the rooms were very clean and well appointed overall. Most of all, the innkeepers were wonderful. They were happy and helpful. They advised us about a great restaurant for dinner (Pomodori -- try it!), and about our next leg of driving. Most importantly, they really seem to enjoy hosting their guests, which was not true in all of the inns we stayed at on our trip. The five-course breakfast was elegant and more than substantial enough to tide us over for most of the day to come. And old town Florence is a quick walk away, and it's a lovely place for a stroll and some shopping.
reviews.title: Wow - what a place!

reviews.text: A lovely inn with great hosts. Enjoy!
reviews.title: Expensive for average accommodation
A true gem
reviews.text: I must admit we were new to the whole B&B thing - we're usually more Budget Inn sort of people - but what a place. There was a mix-up and we ended up with a room with a two-person jacuzzi (poor us), and it was rad drinking wine and kickin it in that thing. Great loco, beautiful house. Lots of little details - teddy bear on the bed, bath oils, chocolates... Like I said, I don't have much to compare it to, but we had a great time.

reviews.title: Great B & B on the Oregon Coast
reviews.text: And breakfast... holy cow! Home made jams, salsas, loafs... 5 courses in all! And eggs, potatoes, and croissants only counted as one course!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most other reviews of this B& B give you a good idea of the quality of this accommodation; and I am in agreement with the positives posted in previous reviews. We enjoyed our stay here; for the location, cleanliness, spacious/quality room and the plentiful breakfasts provided. This is the type of B & B where you feel as if you are a guest in someone’s home – cause that’s exactly what you are. The common area’s are filled with personal family mementos/pictures etc; as are the guest rooms and the owners are very visible and interactive. In some ways it’s familiar and nice and in others it makes you feel as if you have to tip-toe…little close for comfort.
reviews.title: Fine Choice in Florence

reviews.text: Some details: We had a room on the first floor in the rear of the property which had a private screen door/deck to access the small (but lovely) backyard (small green area with a few lounge chairs/table etc and a small waterfall made for a very secluded area for a drink/take-out dinner or reading area etc.) The room itself was spacious, quality queen bed and an enormous bath with a jet tub. Antique type furnishings and a large armoire to store your clothes etc. The room (as is the whole property is exceptionally clean) and in excellent condition. FYI – no TV (which was no prob for us) and no refrigerator/coffee maker etc availability in the room, but you do have a wine bucket and wine glasses. Hot water and teas are set out in the dining room for your use though. We had a small cooler with us for drinks etc – you may want to come prepared.
reviews.title: Skip the apartment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We’ve frequented many B & B throughout the country and this was the first that had a “Book of House Rules” in your guest room. Some were completely understandable from the view of sharing one’s house and it also being a business…but I had to smile cause it also made me feel like the possibility of getting “grounded” by my “parents” over our stay.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good and plentiful – you won’t go hungry! Fruit cups, a hot entrée, breads etc with homemade jams, juice and plenty of coffee/tea at your disposal. The setting is formal (pretty upscale) and when I first saw the large dining table with places of china I thought “am I going to have to dress up?” But it was fine (don’t think you feel comfortable in a tank top and hiking shoes though or anything much wrinkled – just the impression). Be on time for breakfast or they’ll come get you! Also – the property has some history (being a do-it-yourself- Sears made home) so be prepared for a mini-presentation by Marv during breakfast. Marv is very personable and a story teller, so know that at times during your breakfast attention is to him as a group rather than conversations with other guests. He and Laurie take great pride as hosts, it is certainly evident.
reviews.title: Cozy and Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property itself is on a dead-end street which connects to the main street in the quaint town of Florence. There is a living room for use at the front of the house which also has great lemon cookies laid out in the evening. The front porch also has wicker furniture for your use to chill out on after a day of travels. The location is ideal to walking into town for many restaurant choices/lounges/coffee café’s and village shopping. The small town itself is a nice walking town along the river, very quiet and the restaurants choices right in town were very good. Overall people here and the service personnel in the restaurants are extremely nice. The location of the Edwin K is overall very quiet and nice not to be up on the highway main drag etc as other accommodation choices in this area were. We’re glad we chose Florence to stay for the above town reasons after a day at the dunes and travels to hike and sightsee on the coast.
reviews.title: And the winner is.....

description: Built in 1914, the Edwin K Bed and Breakfast defines the traditions of fine accommodations. You may choose from six spacious beautiful rooms that offer custom designed private baths. A five-course breakfast is included for those staying in the B&B. Tea, sherry, and cookies are served at 5:00 p.m. each evening. In addition to our B&B facilities, we also a separate Apartment Suite that sleeps 4 people and is suitable for families and/or those who want more privacy.
